title: Figma Unveils Three AI-Powered Tools Revolutionizing Precise Image Editing in Design and Draw

paragraphs.content: Figma launched three new AI-powered tools—Erase object, Isolate object, and Expand image—on December 10, 2025, enabling precise in-app image edits without exporting to external software like Photoshop.These features integrate into a revamped image editing toolbar that consolidates tools such as Remove background and Crop, prioritizing high-usage actions for designers.Available immediately in Figma Design and Draw for Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled, they emphasize granular control without text prompts.

paragraphs.content: The tools streamline workflows by allowing users to remove unwanted elements, separate subjects for effects like blur or lighting, and extend backgrounds to new aspect ratios without distortion.Designers can now handle tasks like converting square product shots to landscape banners directly on the canvas, reducing platform switches for marketers and teams.This update complements Figma's broader AI suite, including image generation with Gemini 3.0 Pro, positioning the platform as a complete creative hub.

sections.title: Breakdown of Erase, Isolate, and Expand Capabilities

paragraphs.content: Erase object lets users select and remove specific elements using an improved lasso tool, ideal for cleaning up mockups or campaigns without external apps.Isolate object separates subjects for repositioning or adjustments like shadow, color, or focus, while preserving background characteristics for seamless UI tweaks.Figma's blog highlights how these enable faster finessing of details, such as brightening products or desaturating distractions.

paragraphs.content: Expand image adapts assets to fit new formats, filling backgrounds intelligently to maintain integrity across web banners or social media.The centralized toolbar enhances access, with Remove background prominently placed due to its popularity in brand-consistent designs.Demos show real-time applications, like expanding grids or isolating for parallax effects in homepage visuals.

paragraphs.content: ContentGrip praises the tools for minimizing back-and-forth in cross-functional reviews, enabling in-house edits that speed up test variations for marketers.TechCrunch notes Figma catching up to Adobe and Canva, which offered object removal years earlier, amid Adobe's same-day ChatGPT integrations.Figma positions these as assistive AI, focusing on precision over generative prompts like Nano Banana.

Expansion to more Figma products is planned for 2026, alongside integrations with features like AI illustrations and glass effects.This builds on 150+ 2025 updates, including FigJam AI and no-code app building in Figma Make.Analysts foresee reduced dependencies, fostering faster iterations while maintaining creative control.
